meanings.definition: Ten times as much or as many.
meanings.sent1: The giant pumpkin was tenfolds heavier than the small one.
meanings.sent2: She bought tenfolds more candy than she needed for the party.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tail seemed tenfolds longer when it was scared.
meanings.sent4: His excitement grew tenfolds as he got closer to the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower's height was tenfolds greater than the other flowers in the garden.

meanings.sent1: She increased her speed tenfolds to catch up with the bus.
meanings.sent2: The population of the town grew tenfolds in just a few years.
meanings.sent3: The chef's skill improved tenfolds after attending a cooking workshop.
meanings.sent4: The music volume suddenly increased tenfolds, startling everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's determination to win multiplied tenfolds after the defeat in the previous match.
